dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Meuser (for himself and Ms. Lee of Nevada) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce

form.official-title: To ensure that broadband maps are accurate before funds are allocated under the Broadband Equity, Access, and Deployment Program based on those maps.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Accurate Map for Broadband Investment Act of 2023.

section.header: Ensuring accuracy of broadband maps before allocation of funds based on maps
section.text: Section 60102 of the Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act (47 U.S.C. 1702) is amended—

subparagraph.text: by redesignating paragraphs (4) and (5) as paragraphs (5) and (6), respectively; and
by inserting after paragraph (3) the following:
Two hundred and ten days after the date on which the Assistant Secretary allocates amounts to an eligible entity under paragraph (1) or (3), the Assistant Secretary shall—

clause.text: repeat the calculation required under subparagraph (B) of the applicable paragraph based on the most current versions of the broadband DATA maps; and
adjust the allocation under the applicable paragraph as necessary based on the recalculation under clause (i).

subparagraph.header: Use of reallocation in calculating final disbursement

clause.text: The Assistant Secretary may not make grant funds available to an eligible entity under subsection (e)(4) until the Assistant Secretary has complied with subparagraph (A) of this paragraph.

If the Assistant Secretary adjusts the allocation to an eligible entity under this subsection pursuant to subparagraph (A) of this paragraph, the Assistant Secretary shall use the adjusted allocation to determine the amount of grant funds that remain to be made available to the eligible entity under subsection (e)(4).
by redesignating subparagraphs (A) and (B) as clauses (i) and (ii), respectively, and adjusting the margins accordingly;
by striking On or after and inserting the following:
by adding at the end the following:

subparagraph.text: On or after the date on which the Assistant Secretary adjusts the allocation to an eligible entity under subsection (c)(4), the Assistant Secretary shall issue a notice to the eligible entity that contains the adjusted amount available to the eligible entity under subsection (c).

clause.text: in subparagraph (A)(i), in the matter preceding subparagraph (A)—

subclause.text: by striking approvals and inserting approves; and
by inserting (subject to paragraph (4) of that subsection) after subsection (c);

clause.text: in subparagraph (D)(ii)(III), by inserting (subject to paragraph (4) of that subsection) after subsection (c); and
in subparagraph (E)(ii)(III), by inserting (subject to paragraph (4) of that subsection) after subsection (c).
